titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Seth Hollister Letters, 1860-1865
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters to Hollister from his cousins in the 8th Connecticut Regiment during the Civil War and from other soldiers describing the training center at Annapolis, Md.; camp life in Virginia and North Carolina; and New Bern, North Carolina.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Seth Hollister letters, 1860-1865, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Seth Hollister was a resident of Washington (Litchfield County), Connecticut.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters to Hollister from his cousins in the 8th Connecticut Regiment during the Civil War and from other soldiers describing the training center at Annapolis, Md.; camp life in Virginia and North Carolina; and New Bern, North Carolina.

controlaccess.subject: Soldiers -- United States -- Correspondence
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Connecticut Infantry Regiment, 8th (1861-1865)
